text: Is there anyway that I can wrap a code snippet in a hubl reference to GDPR? For example, only include a tracking code snippet if the user has accepted the GDPR cookie policy.
you can check for the consent cookie, and use that : <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/reports/customize-your-cookie-tracking-settings-and-privacy-policy-alert>
How to make Tabs in HUBL ??
HubSpot has a free tabber module in the marketplace. You can download it and get some inspiration :wink:
and they provided several helpful comments in the module

`{{ request.cookies }}`
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-variables>
can you expand on your question?
This is exactly what I was looking for! Thanks <@UAWLEUX1U> and <@U3T21PDBK>

Hey folks -- Could I get some quick insight on the relationship of setting a workflow trigger via and triggering via the html module snippet like so `{% form "my_form" form_to_use='<formID>', title='Register to Watch', response_response_type='inline', response_redirect_url='', follow_up_type_automation='true', form_follow_ups_workflow_id='{{dynamic_page_hubdb_row.workflow_id}}'  %}`

This is a follow up to a question I asked over in <#C22PDRW72|data-driven-content> yesterday.

Any insights?
<@U2H1Q3F8R> are you using this to check and fire other cookies aside from HubSpots using HubSpots cookie banner?
the reason I ask is this is on my todo (working towards compliance over here...don't judge)
Yeah, the idea is if the user hasn't opted into the cookie policy to not trigger linkedin and google tracking codes
No judgement from me :stuck_out_tongue:

This is super similar to what I did the last non-HubSpot website I worked on. We had a little script that blocked tag manager from firing until the user accepted the policy. I haven't figured out how to do it yet with HubSpots cookie deal
mind sending a sample snippet when you get it working? would love  to see how you use it
Absolutely, I was just scoping out the task - but I can share once it is put into production/implemented :slightly_smiling_face:
that would be awesome! thanks!
Hi, does anyone know how to get all the tags? I need to make a list of them
is that per 1 blog, or all tags regardless of if they are in use or not in use?
its both :sweat: I need all tag and then per blog
I'll have to think about gettin ALL topics/tags however
